trans-unit.source: Enable Encryption at Rest in BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Enable Encryption at Rest in BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: You can encrypt messages that are archived (also known as data at rest).
trans-unit.target: You can encrypt messages that are archived (also known as data at rest).

trans-unit.source: This feature is called <legacyBold>Encryption at Rest</legacyBold> and can be enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: This feature is called <legacyBold>Encryption at Rest</legacyBold> and can be enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Enable encryption
trans-unit.target: Enable encryption

trans-unit.source: Open the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Settings</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Settings</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Encryption At Rest</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Encryption At Rest</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Enable encryption for all messages being archived</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Enable encryption for all messages being archived</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Key Name
trans-unit.target: Key Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of your encryption key.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of your encryption key.

trans-unit.source: Encryption Key
trans-unit.target: Encryption Key

trans-unit.source: Enter your encryption key.
trans-unit.target: Enter your encryption key.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> your changes.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> your changes.

trans-unit.source: What you need to know
trans-unit.target: What you need to know

trans-unit.source: Messages are encrypted before being archived.
trans-unit.target: Messages are encrypted before being archived.

trans-unit.source: The AES-256 encryption algorithm is used.
trans-unit.target: The AES-256 encryption algorithm is used.

trans-unit.source: If you change the existing encryption key, only new messages are encrypted with the new key.
trans-unit.target: If you change the existing encryption key, only new messages are encrypted with the new key.

trans-unit.source: Older archived messages continue to remain encrypted with the previous key.
trans-unit.target: Older archived messages continue to remain encrypted with the previous key.

trans-unit.source: When retrieving messages from the archive store, you need decrypt the messages using the key name and the encryption key.
trans-unit.target: When retrieving messages from the archive store, you need decrypt the messages using the key name and the encryption key.

trans-unit.source: Messages being suspended in EDI receive/send are not automatically encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Messages being suspended in EDI receive/send are not automatically encrypted.

trans-unit.source: The user can pass the messages through a pipeline and encrypt the message in that pipeline before routing it to <token>azure_2</token> storage.
trans-unit.target: The user can pass the messages through a pipeline and encrypt the message in that pipeline before routing it to <token>azure_2</token> storage.

trans-unit.source: Create the encryption key
trans-unit.target: Create the encryption key

trans-unit.source: Using the following code, you can create an encryption key and the key name:
trans-unit.target: Using the following code, you can create an encryption key and the key name:
